decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells and creatures to dominate the game. It employs a mix of aggressive spells like Virtue of Strength and Worldsoul's Rage, alongside powerful control cards like Memory Deluge and Ill-Timed Explosion. The deck also includes a range of creatures such as Nissa, Resurgent Animist and Fallaji Archaeologist to maintain board presence and apply pressure. Additionally, the inclusion of Maestros Theater and Cabaretti Courtyard provides card advantage and mana fixing. The overall strategy is to outvalue and outpace the opponent while maintaining control of the board.

This Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful Golgari creatures such as Glissa Sunslayer, Mosswood Dreadknight, and Deep-Cavern Bat to quickly overwhelm opponents. Supporting cards like Go for the Throat and Cut Down help control the board while cards like Liliana of the Veil and Gix's Command provide additional utility. The inclusion of cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal offer powerful late-game threats. With a mix of removal, creatures, and planeswalkers, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures and utilizing powerful aggro tactics to deal damage efficiently. It combines a variety of small, aggressive creatures and combat tricks to maintain pressure and control the battlefield. The deck also includes some control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own creatures. Overall, the key concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to apply relentless offensive pressure and maintain board presence to secure a victory through overwhelming force.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures with abilities that allow for strategic maneuvers and card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells to control the opponent's board, as well as some cards that provide additional benefits when creatures attack. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements while also providing flexibility in casting spells. Overall, this deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game through a combination of creatures and spells.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and removal spells to pressure the opponent early and maintain control of the board. The deck includes powerful creatures like Bloodthirsty Adversary and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, along with efficient removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down. The deck's mana base allows for consistent casting of spells, with a mix of basic lands and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and maintain dominance throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Phoenix Chick, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Strike and Play with Fire to finish off opponents or clear the way for an attack. Cards like Fugitive Codebreaker and Charming Scoundrel provide additional threats, while cards like Monstrous Rage and Witchstalker Frenzy help push through damage and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly deal damage to the opponent's life total using aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Phoenix Chick, backed up by a variety of burn spells like Play with Fire, Lightning Strike, and Felonious Rage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Antagonize. The inclusion of cards like Expedited Inheritance and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provide additional value and late-game reach if the game goes longer than expected.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing counterspells, board wipes, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Get Lost and Make Disappear, while also generating card advantage with cards like Memory Deluge and Jace, the Perfected Mind, the deck aims to slowly grind out a victory. The deck also includes lands that provide additional utility, such as Field of Ruin for land destruction and Spara's Headquarters for card draw. Overall, the deck looks to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through various forms of removal, counterspells, and card advantage. By controlling the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Depopulate, countering key spells with Dissipate and Void Rend, and drawing cards with Jace, the Perfected Mind and Memory Deluge, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Kaya, Intangible Slayer and The Wandering Emperor ensures that the deck can close out the game once it has stabilized the board.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures along with various support cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The combination of powerful creatures like Deep-Cavern Bat and Raffine, Scheming Seer, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Destroy Evil, allows the deck to maintain pressure on the opponent. Other cards like Faerie Mastermind and Dennick, Pious Apprentice provide additional utility and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, ensuring consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient removal spells. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Deep-Cavern Bat and Raffine, Scheming Seer, along with disruptive spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to control the board and clear a path for its creatures to attack. Wedding Announcement and The Wandering Emperor provide additional support and card advantage to maintain pressure on the opponent. The land base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and utility lands.

This Esper Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Raffine, Scheming Seer and Dennick, Pious Apprentice to apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes removal spells like Cut Down and Go for the Throat to deal with threats, along with disruptive spells like No More Lies and Destroy Evil to control the board. The deck also utilizes versatile lands like Restless Anchorage and Shattered Sanctum to support its aggressive game plan, while including a mix of utility lands like Otawara, Soaring City and Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire for added value.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while also being able to control the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down. The deck includes powerful creatures like Mosswood Dreadknight and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, as well as utility cards like Preacher of the Schism and Gix's Command. The deck also features planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Nissa, Ascended Animist to provide additional value and card advantage. The land base is optimized for the deck's curve and color requirements.

This deck focuses on using a combination of powerful control spells and creatures to dominate the board and outlast the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ill-Timed Explosion and Memory Deluge to control the game, as well as including strong creatures like Titania, Voice of Gaea and Nissa, Resurgent Animist, the deck aims to maintain board presence and overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of control and creature cards, this deck is built to adapt to various situations and maintain a strong position throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using various spells and abilities to manipulate the board state and outvalue the opponent. The deck focuses on generating card advantage through cards like Memory Deluge and Aftermath Analyst, while also utilizing removal spells like Worldsoul's Rage and Ill-Timed Explosion to control the opponent's creatures. Additionally, the deck includes powerful win conditions like Nissa, Resurgent Animist and Fallaji Archaeologist to finish off the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The key strategy is to outlast the opponent and grind them out of cards before overwhelming them with powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes. The deck aims to establish and maintain control of the game by limiting the opponent's options and gradually taking over the game with powerful late-game threats like Jace, the Perfected Mind and The Wandering Emperor. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck while providing consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck prioritizes control and manipulation of the game state to secure victory.
